personal.name: Rushiraj Chavan
personal.title: AI Decision Science Analyst
personal.bio: AI Decision Science Analyst at Accenture with 4+ years of experience in building scalable AI systems using LLMs, GenAI, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision and MLOps. Expertise in enterprise-grade cloud architectures (AWS, GCP, Azure) and end-to-end AI pipeline deployment. Delivered multiple high-impact solutions across healthcare, supply chain, pharma, logistics, and design automation with measurable business outcomes including 30% reduction in processing times and 40% improvement in operational efficiency.

education.degree: Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Engineering

education.institution: Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC)

description: Curated and preprocessed large-scale text datasets from PDF reports and CSV files for LLM fine-tuning, implementing GDPR-compliant data handling processes for enterprise stakeholders.
Developed comprehensive annotation workflows and human-in-the-loop validation processes using LangChain and Hugging Face Transformers with dataset documentation and metadata tracking.
Built end-to-end LLM pipeline orchestration via GCP Cloud Run and BigQuery, incorporating data bias detection and automated model evaluation benchmarking.
Established cross-functional collaboration frameworks with ML engineering teams, implementing dataset versioning standards that increased analytical efficiency by 40% across business units.
Spearheaded migration of enterprise AI pipelines from on-prem Kubernetes to AWS (EKS, SageMaker, Lambda, S3), establishing cloud-first architecture enhancing scalability and security.
Led deployment of NLP-CV models for medical claims automation processing 100K+ documents per hour, reducing turnaround time by 30% with GDPR/HIPAA-compliant workflows.
Developed generative AI systems for wood pattern design using Stable Diffusion models on AWS EC2 (g4dn instances), reducing design turnaround time by 40%.
Engineered end-to-end LLM-powered document intelligence pipelines leveraging AWS Bedrock, S3, Lambda, and EKS for enterprise-grade deployments.
Standardized MLOps workflows using AWS-native CI/CD (CodePipeline, CloudFormation) and Kubernetes with automated testing and production rollouts.

projects.name: Medical Claims AI for National Health Authority
projects.description: Built comprehensive ML pipeline using LLMs, NLP & Computer Vision achieving 94% accuracy with Logistic Regression for text classification and ResNet-18/ResNet-50 for image classification. Deployed on AWS Kubernetes clusters processing 100K+ documents per hour with complete MLOps pipeline including load testing using Locust, Kibana, Grafana, and CloudWatch.

projects.name: Wood Pattern Image Regeneration (GenAI)
projects.description: Developed generative AI system using Stable Diffusion for wood pattern regeneration enabling recreation and extension of design samples. Built GPU-backed API endpoints on AWS EC2 (g4dn) with feedback pipelines via S3 and Lambda. Implemented Streamlit front-end for real-time designer interaction, reducing manual design workload by 40%.

projects.name: Document Question & Answering System
projects.description: Designed data extraction systems using Large Language Models like GPT-4 leveraging PyTorch and TensorFlow for high accuracy. Developed data pipelines for extraction, processing, and storage in Chroma DB with performance testing and optimization on cloud platforms using Kubernetes.

projects.name: Cold Storage Truck Consolidation Optimization
projects.description: Developed bin-packing optimization models (First Fit & Best Fit) for truck routing, reducing logistics cost by 15% with Streamlit dashboard for ROI analysis.

projects.name: Supply Chain What-If Simulations for Pharma
projects.description: Built cost & carbon emission simulation models enabling pharma companies to analyze supply chain trade-offs using advanced statistical modeling and decision support systems.

achievements: Client Appreciation - Super Hero Award (Unilever, 2025) - Top performer out of 100+ teams
Published 'Speech-to-speech translation using deep learning-based models and cloud services' in GIS Science Journal, 2022 (Cited by 1)
Microsoft Azure Associate Data Scientist Certification DP-100
Speaker at PyCon Limerick, Ireland, 2023 - Presented on Stable Diffusion and generative AI advancements
